section_id: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport

hints.label: lem-cloning-conditional-independence
hints.title: Conditional Independence of Cloning
hints.content:
829: :label: lem-cloning-conditional-independence
830: 
831: Conditioned on the alive set $\mathcal{A}(S)$ and the virtual rewards $\{r_i^{\text{virt}}\}_{i \in \mathcal{A}}$, the cloning operator acts **independently** on each dead walker:
832: 
833: $$
834: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S) | \mathcal{A}, \{r_i^{\text{virt}}\} = \prod_{i \in \mathcal{D}} K_i^{\text{clone}}(w_i | \mathcal{A}, \{r_j^{\text{virt}}\}_{j \in \mathcal{A}})
835: $$
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
826: The key structural property is:
827: 
828: :::{prf:lemma} Conditional Independence of Cloning
829: :label: lem-cloning-conditional-independence
830: 
831: Conditioned on the alive set $\mathcal{A}(S)$ and the virtual rewards $\{r_i^{\text{virt}}\}_{i \in \mathcal{A}}$, the cloning operator acts **independently** on each dead walker:
832: 
833: $$
834: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S) | \mathcal{A}, \{r_i^{\text{virt}}\} = \prod_{i \in \mathcal{D}} K_i^{\text{clone}}(w_i | \mathcal{A}, \{r_j^{\text{virt}}\}_{j \in \mathcal{A}})
835: $$
836:

hints.label: thm-hwi-inequality
hints.title: The HWI Inequality (Otto-Villani)
hints.content:
845: :label: thm-hwi-inequality
846: 
847: For probability measures $\mu, \pi$ on $\mathbb{R}^d$ with $\mu \ll \pi$ and $\pi$ log-concave, the following inequality holds:
848: 
849: $$
850: H(\mu | \pi) \le W_2(\mu, \pi) \sqrt{I(\mu | \pi)}
851: $$
852: 
853: where:
854: - $H(\mu | \pi) := D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi)$ is the relative entropy
855: - $W_2(\mu, \pi)$ is the 2-Wasserstein distance
856: - $I(\mu | \pi)$ is the Fisher information
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
842: The direct path from variance contraction to LSI via entropy estimates is **invalid** (as Gemini correctly identified). Instead, we use the **optimal transport approach** via the HWI inequality.
843: 
844: :::{prf:theorem} The HWI Inequality (Otto-Villani)
845: :label: thm-hwi-inequality
846: 
847: For probability measures $\mu, \pi$ on $\mathbb{R}^d$ with $\mu \ll \pi$ and $\pi$ log-concave, the following inequality holds:
848: 
849: $$
850: H(\mu | \pi) \le W_2(\mu, \pi) \sqrt{I(\mu | \pi)}
851: $$
852: 
853: where:
854: - $H(\mu | \pi) := D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi)$ is the relative entropy
855: - $W_2(\mu, \pi)$ is the 2-Wasserstein distance
856: - $I(\mu | \pi)$ is the Fisher information
857:

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-45
hints.content:
860: 
861: :::{prf:remark}
862: The HWI inequality provides a **bridge** between:
863: - Wasserstein contraction (geometric, metric space)
864: - Entropy convergence (information-theoretic)
865: - Fisher information (local regularity)
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
859: :::
860: 
861: :::{prf:remark}
862: The HWI inequality provides a **bridge** between:
863: - Wasserstein contraction (geometric, metric space)
864: - Entropy convergence (information-theoretic)
865: - Fisher information (local regularity)
866:

hints.label: lem-cloning-wasserstein-contraction
hints.title: Wasserstein-2 Contraction for Cloning
hints.content:
873: :label: lem-cloning-wasserstein-contraction
874: 
875: The cloning operator with Gaussian noise contracts the 2-Wasserstein distance. Specifically, for two swarm states $S_1, S_2$:
876: 
877: $$
878: \mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'})] \le (1 - \kappa_W) W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2}) + C_W
879: $$
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
870: ### 4.3. Wasserstein Contraction of the Cloning Operator
871: 
872: :::{prf:lemma} Wasserstein-2 Contraction for Cloning
873: :label: lem-cloning-wasserstein-contraction
874: 
875: The cloning operator with Gaussian noise contracts the 2-Wasserstein distance. Specifically, for two swarm states $S_1, S_2$:
876: 
877: $$
878: \mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'})] \le (1 - \kappa_W) W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2}) + C_W
879: $$
880:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-68
hints.content:
884: :::{prf:proof}
885: 
886: **Status: ✅ RIGOROUSLY PROVEN**
887: 
888: The complete proof is provided in [03_wasserstein_contraction_complete.md](03_wasserstein_contraction_complete.md). The proof establishes:
889: 
890: 1. **Synchronous coupling:** Walkers from two swarms are paired using a shared matching $M$, shared cloning thresholds, and shared jitter noise to maximize correlation
891: 
892: 2. **Outlier Alignment Lemma:** Proved that outliers in separated swarms align directionally away from each other - an **emergent property** from cloning dynamics, not an additional axiom
893: 
894: 3. **Case Analysis:**
895:    - **Case A** (consistent fitness ordering): Exploits jitter cancellation when walkers clone in both swarms
896:    - **Case B** (mixed fitness ordering): Uses Outlier Alignment to prove strong contraction with corrected scaling
897: 
898: 4. **Integration:** Summed over all pairs in matching, then integrated over matching distribution $P(M|S_1)$
899: 
900: The explicit constants are:
901: - $\kappa_W = \frac{p_u \eta}{2} > 0$: Wasserstein contraction rate (N-uniform)
902:   - $p_u > 0$: uniform cloning probability for unfit walkers (Lemma 8.3.2, [03_cloning.md](03_cloning.md))
903:   - $\eta > 0$: Outlier Alignment constant
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
882: :::
883: 
884: :::{prf:proof}
885: 
886: **Status: ✅ RIGOROUSLY PROVEN**
887: 
888: The complete proof is provided in [03_wasserstein_contraction_complete.md](03_wasserstein_contraction_complete.md). The proof establishes:
889: 
890: 1. **Synchronous coupling:** Walkers from two swarms are paired using a shared matching $M$, shared cloning thresholds, and shared jitter noise to maximize correlation
891: 
892: 2. **Outlier Alignment Lemma:** Proved that outliers in separated swarms align directionally away from each other - an **emergent property** from cloning dynamics, not an additional axiom
893: 
894: 3. **Case Analysis:**
895:    - **Case A** (consistent fitness ordering): Exploits jitter cancellation when walkers clone in both swarms
896:    - **Case B** (mixed fitness ordering): Uses Outlier Alignment to prove strong contraction with corrected scaling
897: 
898: 4. **Integration:** Summed over all pairs in matching, then integrated over matching distribution $P(M|S_1)$
899: 
900: The explicit constants are:
901: - $\kappa_W = \frac{p_u \eta}{2} > 0$: Wasserstein contraction rate (N-uniform)
902:   - $p_u > 0$: uniform cloning probability for unfit walkers (Lemma 8.3.2, [03_cloning.md](03_cloning.md))
903:   - $\eta > 0$: Outlier Alignment constant
904: - $C_W < \infty$: Additive constant (state-independent)

hints.label: lem-cloning-fisher-info
hints.title: Fisher Information Bound After Cloning
hints.content:
911: :label: lem-cloning-fisher-info
912: 
913: For the cloning operator with Gaussian noise parameter $\delta > 0$, the Fisher information after one cloning step is bounded:
914: 
915: $$
916: I(\mu_{S'} | \pi) \le \frac{C_I}{\delta^2}
917: $$
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
908: ### 4.4. Fisher Information Control via Gaussian Smoothing
909: 
910: :::{prf:lemma} Fisher Information Bound After Cloning
911: :label: lem-cloning-fisher-info
912: 
913: For the cloning operator with Gaussian noise parameter $\delta > 0$, the Fisher information after one cloning step is bounded:
914: 
915: $$
916: I(\mu_{S'} | \pi) \le \frac{C_I}{\delta^2}
917: $$
918:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-106
hints.content:
921: 
922: :::{prf:proof}
923: **Step 1: Decomposition**
924: 
925: The cloning operator consists of resampling followed by Gaussian convolution with variance $\delta^2 I$.
926: 
927: **Step 2: Gaussian smoothing regularizes Fisher information**
928: 
929: For any measure $\mu$ and Gaussian kernel $G_\delta$:
930: 
931: $$
932: I(\mu * G_\delta | \pi) = \int \left\| \nabla \log \frac{d(\mu * G_\delta)}{d\pi} \right\|^2 d(\mu * G_\delta)
933: $$
934: 
935: By the Young convolution inequality and properties of Gaussian derivatives:
936: 
937: $$
938: \nabla (\mu * G_\delta) = \mu * (\nabla G_\delta)
939: $$
940: 
941: The gradient of the Gaussian satisfies:
942: 
943: $$
944: \|\nabla G_\delta(x)\| \le \frac{C_d}{\delta^{d+1}} e^{-|x|^2/(4\delta^2)}
945: $$
946: 
947: **Step 3: Bounded domain control**
948: 
949: On the bounded domain $\mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}$ with diameter $D$:
950: 
951: $$
952: I(\mu * G_\delta | \pi) \le \frac{C(d, D, N)}{\delta^2}
953: $$
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
920: :::
921: 
922: :::{prf:proof}
923: **Step 1: Decomposition**
924: 
925: The cloning operator consists of resampling followed by Gaussian convolution with variance $\delta^2 I$.
926: 
927: **Step 2: Gaussian smoothing regularizes Fisher information**
928: 
929: For any measure $\mu$ and Gaussian kernel $G_\delta$:
930: 
931: $$
932: I(\mu * G_\delta | \pi) = \int \left\| \nabla \log \frac{d(\mu * G_\delta)}{d\pi} \right\|^2 d(\mu * G_\delta)
933: $$
934: 
935: By the Young convolution inequality and properties of Gaussian derivatives:
936: 
937: $$
938: \nabla (\mu * G_\delta) = \mu * (\nabla G_\delta)
939: $$
940: 
941: The gradient of the Gaussian satisfies:
942: 
943: $$
944: \|\nabla G_\delta(x)\| \le \frac{C_d}{\delta^{d+1}} e^{-|x|^2/(4\delta^2)}
945: $$
946: 
947: **Step 3: Bounded domain control**
948: 
949: On the bounded domain $\mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}$ with diameter $D$:
950: 
951: $$
952: I(\mu * G_\delta | \pi) \le \frac{C(d, D, N)}{\delta^2}
953: $$
954:

hints.label: thm-cloning-entropy-contraction
hints.title: Entropy Contraction for the Cloning Operator
hints.content:
961: :label: thm-cloning-entropy-contraction
962: 
963: For the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ with Gaussian noise variance $\delta^2 > 0$, the relative entropy contracts:
964: 
965: $$
966: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le \left(1 - \frac{\kappa_W^2 \delta^2}{2C_I}\right) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_S \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) + C_{\text{clone}}
967: $$
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
958: ### 4.5. Entropy Contraction via HWI
959: 
960: :::{prf:theorem} Entropy Contraction for the Cloning Operator
961: :label: thm-cloning-entropy-contraction
962: 
963: For the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ with Gaussian noise variance $\delta^2 > 0$, the relative entropy contracts:
964: 
965: $$
966: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le \left(1 - \frac{\kappa_W^2 \delta^2}{2C_I}\right) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_S \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) + C_{\text{clone}}
967: $$
968:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-156
hints.content:
971: 
972: :::{prf:proof}
973: **Step 1: Apply the HWI inequality**
974: 
975: From Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-hwi-inequality`:
976: 
977: $$
978: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le W_2(\mu_{S'}, \pi) \sqrt{I(\mu_{S'} | \pi)}
979: $$
980: 
981: **Step 2: Bound Wasserstein distance**
982: 
983: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-cloning-wasserstein-contraction`:
984: 
985: $$
986: W_2^2(\mu_{S'}, \pi) \le (1 - \kappa_W) W_2^2(\mu_S, \pi) + C_W
987: $$
988: 
989: **Step 3: Bound Fisher information**
990: 
991: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-cloning-fisher-info`:
992: 
993: $$
994: I(\mu_{S'} | \pi) \le \frac{C_I}{\delta^2}
995: $$
996: 
997: **Step 4: Combine the bounds**
998: 
999: $$
1000: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le \sqrt{(1 - \kappa_W) W_2^2(\mu_S, \pi) + C_W} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{C_I}{\delta^2}}
1001: $$
1002: 
1003: $$
1004: \le \sqrt{1 - \kappa_W} \cdot W_2(\mu_S, \pi) \cdot \frac{\sqrt{C_I}}{\delta} + \text{const}
1005: $$
1006: 
1007: **Step 5: Control initial Wasserstein by entropy**
1008: 
1009: By the reverse Talagrand inequality (Villani, 2009), for log-concave $\pi$:
1010: 
1011: $$
1012: W_2^2(\mu, \pi) \le \frac{2}{\lambda_{\min}(\text{Hess} \log \pi)} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi)
1013: $$
1014: 
1015: where $\lambda_{\min} \ge \kappa_{\text{conf}}$ is the convexity constant of the confining potential.
1016: 
1017: **Step 6: Final entropy contraction**
1018: 
1019: Combining all bounds:
1020: 
1021: $$
1022: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le \sqrt{1 - \kappa_W} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{2}{\kappa_{\text{conf}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_S \| \pi)} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{C_I}}{\delta}
1023: $$
1024: 
1025: For small $\kappa_W$, using $(1 - \kappa_W)^{1/2} \approx 1 - \kappa_W/2$:
1026: 
1027: $$
1028: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le \left(1 - \frac{\kappa_W}{2}\right) \cdot \frac{\sqrt{2C_I}}{\delta\sqrt{\kappa_{\text{conf}}}} \sqrt{D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_S \| \pi)}
1029: $$
hints.section: ## 4. The Cloning Operator and Entropy Contraction via Optimal Transport
hints.raw_directive:
970: :::
971: 
972: :::{prf:proof}
973: **Step 1: Apply the HWI inequality**
974: 
975: From Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-hwi-inequality`:
976: 
977: $$
978: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le W_2(\mu_{S'}, \pi) \sqrt{I(\mu_{S'} | \pi)}
979: $$
980: 
981: **Step 2: Bound Wasserstein distance**
982: 
983: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-cloning-wasserstein-contraction`:
984: 
985: $$
986: W_2^2(\mu_{S'}, \pi) \le (1 - \kappa_W) W_2^2(\mu_S, \pi) + C_W
987: $$
988: 
989: **Step 3: Bound Fisher information**
990: 
991: From Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-cloning-fisher-info`:
992: 
993: $$
994: I(\mu_{S'} | \pi) \le \frac{C_I}{\delta^2}
995: $$
996: 
997: **Step 4: Combine the bounds**
998: 
999: $$
1000: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le \sqrt{(1 - \kappa_W) W_2^2(\mu_S, \pi) + C_W} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{C_I}{\delta^2}}
1001: $$
1002: 
1003: $$
1004: \le \sqrt{1 - \kappa_W} \cdot W_2(\mu_S, \pi) \cdot \frac{\sqrt{C_I}}{\delta} + \text{const}
1005: $$
1006: 
1007: **Step 5: Control initial Wasserstein by entropy**
1008: 
1009: By the reverse Talagrand inequality (Villani, 2009), for log-concave $\pi$:
1010: 
1011: $$
1012: W_2^2(\mu, \pi) \le \frac{2}{\lambda_{\min}(\text{Hess} \log \pi)} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi)
1013: $$
1014: 
1015: where $\lambda_{\min} \ge \kappa_{\text{conf}}$ is the convexity constant of the confining potential.
1016: 
1017: **Step 6: Final entropy contraction**
1018: 
1019: Combining all bounds:
1020: 
1021: $$
1022: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le \sqrt{1 - \kappa_W} \cdot \sqrt{\frac{2}{\kappa_{\text{conf}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_S \| \pi)} \cdot \frac{\sqrt{C_I}}{\delta}
1023: $$
1024: 
1025: For small $\kappa_W$, using $(1 - \kappa_W)^{1/2} \approx 1 - \kappa_W/2$:
1026: 
1027: $$
1028: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{S'} \| \pi) \le \left(1 - \frac{\kappa_W}{2}\right) \cdot \frac{\sqrt{2C_I}}{\delta\sqrt{\kappa_{\text{conf}}}} \sqrt{D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_S \| \pi)}
1029: $$
1030:

hints.label: rem-cloning-sublinear
hints.title: Interpretation
hints.content:
1035: :label: rem-cloning-sublinear
1036: 
1037: **Key insight:** The cloning operator alone does **not** satisfy a full LSI. It provides:
1038: 1. **Wasserstein contraction** (linear in $W_2^2$)
1039: 2. **Sublinear entropy contraction** (via HWI)
1040: 
1041: The **linear entropy contraction** emerges only when composed with the kinetic operator, which:
1042: - Provides diffusion to control Fisher information
1043: - Converts Wasserstein contraction to entropy contraction via the gradient flow structure

hints.raw_directive:
1032: :::
1033: 
1034: :::{prf:remark} Interpretation
1035: :label: rem-cloning-sublinear
1036: 
1037: **Key insight:** The cloning operator alone does **not** satisfy a full LSI. It provides:
1038: 1. **Wasserstein contraction** (linear in $W_2^2$)
1039: 2. **Sublinear entropy contraction** (via HWI)
1040: 
1041: The **linear entropy contraction** emerges only when composed with the kinetic operator, which:
1042: - Provides diffusion to control Fisher information
1043: - Converts Wasserstein contraction to entropy contraction via the gradient flow structure
1044:
